result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron C Brown

defendant.name: Brown, Myron C
defendant.address: 3339 North Vel R Phillips Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53212

records.addlTxt:
Bench Warrant was issued 9/28/2022 and the 10/12/2022 Pretrial Conference in Branch 15 should have been cancelled. 
Clerk removed the 10/12/2022 Pretrial Conference set at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 15.

Defendant Myron C Brown not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Defendant failed to be booked and released by September 23rd, 2022 by 5:00PM. Court took no action as to bail.

Court ordered no use or possession of any firearms or dangerous weapons. 

Court orders defendant to report to the Milwaukee County Jail by 5:00 pm on 09-23-2022 to be booked and released. Failure to report will result in the issuance of a bench warrant.

Defendant Myron C Brown in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/21/22 @ 2p
